# Development of a Mathematical Reasoning LLM

Developed a Mathematical Reasoning LLM by finetuning Qwen2 0.5B model on two stage pipeline(SFT+DPO)

### Description:

**Orchestrated a Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT)** phase using the meta-math/MetaMathQA dataset to train the Qwen2-0.5B model on structured, step-by-step mathematical problem-solving, establishing a strong baseline for logical reasoning.

**Implemented an advanced alignment stage with Direct Preference Optimization (DPO)**, training the model to distinguish between correct and incorrect reasoning paths using the Intel/orca_dpo_pairs preference dataset, significantly improving the reliability of its outputs.

**Engineered a memory-efficient training process by integrating Unsloth**, 4-bit quantization (QLoRA), and Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning (PEFT), enabling the entire SFT-to-DPO pipeline to execute successfully on a single, free-tier Google Colab GPU.

**Curated and preprocessed specialized datasets**, creating custom data formatting pipelines to structure diverse math problems for both instructional (SFT) and preference-based (DPO) training phases.

**Demonstrated model capabilities by validating its performance on novel mathematical problems**, showing its ability to generate detailed, step-by-step solutions that were not present in the training data.

**Managed the complete model lifecycle**, from loading the base pre-trained model and applying LoRA adapters to executing the multi-stage training, performing inference, and saving the final, specialized model artifacts.

**Example:**
